page.title: 16WANLIP VILLAGE
page.content: Wanlip is a small village with a population of about 156 (including 20 children) 2 miles north of Birstall. It is on the banks of the Soar. There are no shops, public houses and the nearest petrol station is in Syston. The parish does include the High School and the Upper School. Wanlip has no council. All they have is a village meeting twice a year. There is one bus a day. There is{no supply of gas,}the only fuel is coke, coal or calor gas.{There {is sometimes a smell which comes from {the farmer's silage}not from the Sewage Works. Wanlip sewage does not go to the local sewage works. Manor Farm grows a lot of potatoes, they store them in an aluminium barn which needs insulating fron the frost. The Parish Church, gravel workings and Country Park are outside our block
